results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of permutations p of [n] such that max(|p(i)-i|)=k (n>=1, 0<=k<=n-1).
comment: Row sums are the factorials. T(n,n) = (n-2)!*(2n-3) = A007680(n-2) (for n>=2). T(n,1) = Fibonacci(n+1)-1 = A000071(n+1). Sum_{k=0..n-1} k*T(n,k) = A130153(n). For the statistic max(p(i)-i) see A056151.

maple: with(combinat): for n from 1 to 7 do P:=permute(n): for i from 0 to n-1 do ct[i]:=0 od: for j from 1 to n! do if max(seq(abs(P[j][i]-i),i=1..n))=0 then ct[0]:=ct[0]+1 elif max(seq(abs(P[j][i]-i),i=1..n))=1 then ct[1]:=ct[1]+1 elif max(seq(abs(P[j][i]-i),i=1..n))=2 then ct[2]:=ct[2]+1 elif max(seq(abs(P[j][i]-i),i=1..n))=3 then ct[3]:=ct[3]+1 elif max(seq(abs(P[j][i]-i),i=1..n))=4 then ct[4]:=ct[4]+1 elif max(seq(abs(P[j][i]-i),i=1..n))=5 then ct[5]:=ct[5]+1 elif max(seq(abs(P[j][i]-i),i=1..n))=6 then ct[6]:=ct[6]+1 else fi od: a[n]:=seq(ct[i],i=0..n-1): od: for n from 1 to 7 do a[n] od; # a cumbersome program to obtain, by straightforward counting, the first 7 rows of the triangle

n := 8: st := proc (p) max(seq(abs(p[j]-j), j = 1 .. nops(p))) end proc: with(combinat): P := permute(n): f := sort(add(t^st(P[i]), i = 1 .. factorial(n))); # program gives the row generating polynomial for the specified n - _Emeric Deutsch_, Aug 13 2009

program: (C++) #include <iostream> #include <vector> #include <algorithm> using namespace std; inline int k(const vector<int> & s) { const int n = s.size() ; int kmax = 0 ; for(int i=0; i<n; i++) { const int thisdiff = abs(s[i]-i-1) ; if ( thisdiff > kmax) kmax = thisdiff ; } return kmax ; } int main(int argc, char *argv[]) { for(int n=1 ;;n++) { vector<int> s; for(int i=1;i<=n;i++) s.push_back(i) ; vector<unsigned long long> resul(n); do { resul[k(s)]++ ; } while( next_permutation(s.begin(),s.end()) ) ; for(int i=0;i<n;i++) cout << resul[i] << ", " ; cout << endl ; } return 0 ; } - _R.
